channel.title: My Room
channel.description:
Couple of hours.. (Forgot to save last time :mad:) 2nd day with C4D.. or 3rd.. Don't remember..
Still a long way to go.. Finally getting the hang of it..A bit..
[IMG]http://img523.imageshack.us/img523/7739/maroomcopycm8.png[/img]
Now no one can rip :rolleyes:

item.title: My Room
item.dc:creator: @FastBallz FastBawlz
item.description:
@FastBallz wrote:

[quote=“Mr.Chris, post:49, topic:106471”]You don’t half make me /wrists FBz… <3

Remember, booleans can overload. You use too many, C4D will just lag out. Many things can be solved without booleans. Extruding and deleting for example, without the need for a boolean.

Also, remember, when box modeling, start with a load of polygons. It will lag loads when moving, but it’s so much easier to and so many things can be modeled with box modeling. Also, it’s very unlikely for an overload, where as booleans is very likely.[/quote]

Thats true but when you delete something it makes it hollow… Which could work and does work for some of the things that I did …Like the thing where I put my CD’s in, I used Invert to make the face smaller then deleted… And a Wii is not that Hollow… OMFG I almost forgot to do the Wii motess :D…

I never overloaded with a Boolean, I overloaded while rendering a CD I was making :|…

Read full topic

item.title: My Room
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

You don’t half make me /wrists FBz… <3

Remember, booleans can overload. You use too many, C4D will just lag out. Many things can be solved without booleans. Extruding and deleting for example, without the need for a boolean.

Also, remember, when box modeling, start with a load of polygons. It will lag loads when moving, but it’s so much easier to and so many things can be modeled with box modeling. Also, it’s very unlikely for an overload, where as booleans is very likely.

Read full topic
